name: Fair Trade Certified
description: Standards around fair wages, safe working conditions, and community development funds.

name: Rainforest Alliance
description: Focuses on biodiversity conservation and sustainable livelihoods in agriculture and forestry.

name: B Corp Certification
description: Certifies companies meeting high standards of social and environmental performance, accountability, and transparency.

name: GOTS (Global Organic Textile Standard)
description: Organic fiber standard covering ecological and social criteria.

name: FSC
description: Responsible forest management for wood/paper products.

name: OEKO-TEX Standard 100
description: Tests textiles for harmful substances.

name: Cradle to Cradle
description: Multi-attribute product standard focusing on circular design and material health.

name: Clean Clothes Campaign
description: Advocacy network focused on improving working conditions in the global garment industry.

name: CanopyStyle
description: Works with brands to eliminate ancient and endangered forest fiber from viscose and other cellulosic textiles.

name: Better Cotton (BCI)
description: Focuses on improving cotton farming globally with better environmental and social outcomes.

name: bluesign
description: Manages input streams in textile supply chains to remove harmful substances and optimize resource use.

name: Soil Association Organic
description: UK-based organic standards for food, farming, and personal care.

name: WRAP
description: Worldwide Responsible Accredited Production – certifies factories for responsible labor and compliance practices.

name: Responsible Wool Standard (RWS)
description: Ensures wool comes from farms with high animal welfare and land management standards.

name: Nordic Swan Ecolabel
description: Official Nordic ecolabel with strict criteria across product categories.

name: ZQ Merino
description: Standard for merino wool that covers animal welfare, environmental care, and social responsibility.

name: Responsible Down Standard (RDS)
description: Ensures down and feathers come from animals that have not been subjected to unnecessary harm.

name: Global Recycled Standard (GRS)
description: Tracks recycled content and social/environmental practices in supply chains.

name: Organic Content Standard (OCS)
description: Verifies organic content in final products without broader social criteria.

name: MADE IN GREEN by OEKO-TEX
description: Traceable product label for textiles made in environmentally friendly and socially responsible facilities.

name: Fair Wear
description: Focuses on improving workplace conditions in garment factories.

name: Fairtrade International (FLO)
description: Global standard-setting body for Fairtrade certification.

name: SA8000
description: Social accountability standard for decent working conditions.

name: Carbon Trust Footprint
description: Labels products with their carbon footprint and reductions.

name: Carbon Neutral Product (Climate Impact Partners)
description: Signifies products with measured and offset carbon footprints.

name: Carbon Care Certified
description: Label for organisations and products meeting certain carbon management standards.

name: Leaping Bunny (Cruelty Free International)
description: Global standard for cruelty-free cosmetics, personal care, and household products.

name: Certified Naturally Grown
description: Peer-review based certification for small-scale farmers using natural methods.

name: USDA Organic
description: US National Organic Program seal for food and agriculture.

name: Audubon International
description: Certifies golf courses, resorts, and communities for environmental management.

name: Best Aquaculture Practices (BAP)
description: Certifies seafood farms, hatcheries, feed mills, and processing plants for environmental and social responsibility.

name: Certified Vegan
description: Logo indicating products free of animal ingredients and testing.

name: Animal Welfare Approved (AGW)
description: High-welfare, pasture-based livestock certification by A Greener World.

name: ENERGY STAR
description: US EPA label for energy-efficient products and buildings.

name: Green Seal
description: Multi-attribute environmental certification for products and services.

name: Wildlife Friendly
description: Certifies products and enterprises that protect wildlife and habitats.

name: Bird Friendly (Smithsonian)
description: Coffee certification ensuring shade-grown, biodiversity-supporting farms.

name: Carbonfree
description: Indicates that a product’s carbon emissions have been measured and offset.

name: Climate Registered (The Climate Registry)
description: Recognizes organizations for measuring, reporting, and reducing greenhouse gas emissions.

name: LEED
description: Green building certification system by the U.S. Green Building Council.
